page.title: 06Housing - Mattingley Area.
page.content: The hamlets have a long history & a wealth of older dwellings, some of which are C.16th.{Bricks are the local {building material}but there are many examples of{half timbered cottages, some with thatched roofs & some disguised with rendering & whitewash. Between the hamlets are the many scattered farmhouses, largely C.17th. Then there are the{big houses}set in several acres of grounds. West Green House is now a National Trust property but there are also Hazeley House, Inholmes Court, The Dutch House & Hartley Grange (now flats). On the eastern edge of the block are the outskirts of Hartley Wintney including a{modern development}of larger detached houses. There are also a few{council owned properties}within the block.
